duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage and oversee the daily operations of the office, including reviewing and processing expense reports and maintaining the physical office space.
Manage the Vice President's complex calendar and prioritize tasks to ensure effective use of time.
Anticipate the needs of the Vice President and pre-plan/prepares in advance.
Receive and review incoming requests, prioritizing them according to significance and urgency.
Prepare confidential letters and materials for faculty hiring and promotion processes.

Coordinate a variety of meetings, events, or team-building activities, including managing logistics, distributing meeting materials, taking meeting minutes, managing attendee lists, and coordinating room reservations and/or catering needs.
Coordinate complex travel arrangements as necessary.
Work collaboratively with other administrators and support staff throughout the University.
Serve as the initial point of contact for guests, creating a welcoming and hospitable environment.
Support or project-manage special projects, as needed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience (Master's preferred)
